document.masterDocTitle: Updated checklist of the Cantharidae, Lampyridae, and Lycidae of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg (Coleoptera: Elateroidea)

( s. str. ) decipiens
Baudi di Selve, 1872

Note.
C. nigra
is often and easily confused with
Cantharis flavilabris
. The presence and distribution in Luxembourg need to be further studied.

Note.

is a hygrophilous species, not rare in humid environments.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gerend et al. 2007
; KÃ¶hler 2009 ; Zagatti & MÃ©riguet 2014 (Benelux).

Note.
C. pulicaria
is a rather rare species throughout the distributional range. We do not know any collection specimen from Luxembourg , so the actual distribution in the Grand Duchy must be confirmed.

Note. Reported as
Cantharis
( s. str. ) darwiniana (Sharp, 1867): Kazantsev & Brancucci 2007 ; Kazantsev 2012 .
Magis 1956 , 1968 , 1971 , 1972 ; Kazantsev & Brancucci 2007 ; Silkin 2008 ; Kazantsev 2012 ; KÃ¶hler 2013 .

Cantharis ( s. str. ) terminata
Faldermann, 1835
( Fig. 2 )

Material. Luxembourg Hollerich, 10.VI.1975 , C. Hahn leg.,
1 spec. [ MNHNL ]; Strassen ,
13.IX.1998
, A. Mousset leg.
,
1 spec. [ MNHNL ]; Strassen , Ruderlech ,
on
Tilea
,
24. V .2009
, F. Vitali leg.
,
1 spec. [coll. F. Vitali ]; Luxembourg BambÃ«sch ,
17. V .2014
, F. Vitali
, 1 spec. [coll. F. Vitali].

Note.
C. terminata
is a rare montane species, similar to
Cantharis quadripunctata (O. F. MÃ¼ller, 1776)
and
C. montana Stierlin, 1898
but basically with a black elytral margin. The species is widespread in Europe and the Middle East, and common in Belgian Luxembourg ( Everts 1922 ; Horion 1953 ).

Note. This species is often confused with
Rhagonycha gallica Pic, 1923
and
Rhagonycha atra (Linnaeus, 1767)
. We do not know collection specimens from Luxembourg ; therefore, its actual presence must be verified.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Cantharis terminata Faldermann, 1835
. Specimen preserved at the National Museum of Natural History of Luxembourg, scale bar = 1.0 mm.
